text.1: Allah explains that this surah contains two things. First, laws that must be obeyed, as will be conveyed in the following verses regarding adultery (zina), accusing women of adultery, and so on. These laws, if considered by humans with objective minds, will certainly be acknowledged as true provisions originating from Allah and not made by humans. All of this was revealed to be obeyed and implemented in life. Second, tangible evidence that points to the power and oneness of Allah in this world.
text.2:
In this verse, Allah explains that Muslim men and women who commit adultery, who are of sound mind, free, and not *muhsan*, are to be flogged one hundred times as punishment for their actions. *Muhsan* refers to a man or woman who has been married and had sexual intercourse. Not *muhsan* means never having been married and had sexual intercourse, meaning a virgin or bachelor. If they commit adultery, the punishment is one hundred lashes. The flogging must be carried out without mercy, that is, without stopping, provided it does not result in injury or broken bones.

For those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, it is not permissible, even forbidden, to have mercy on those who violate this law and do not carry out the provisions that have been outlined in the religion of Allah. Prophet Muhammad must be taken as an example or role model in upholding the law. He once said:

From 'Aisyah, the Messenger of Allah said, "If Fatimah binti Muhammad were to steal, I would surely cut off her hand." (Narrated by *asy-Syaikhan*)

The flogging punishment should be carried out by those in authority and done in a public and respectable place, such as a mosque, so that it can be witnessed by many people, with the intention that those who witness the implementation of the flogging punishment will learn a lesson, so that they can truly restrain themselves from committing adultery. As for *muhsan* adulterers, both men and women, the punishment is to be stoned to death, which in Islamic terminology is called "rajam." This *rajam* punishment is also carried out by those in authority and done in a public place that can be witnessed by many people. This *rajam* law is based on the *sunnah* of the Prophet (saw) which is *mutawatir*.

It is narrated from Abu Bakar, Umar, Ali, Jabir bin Abdillah, Abu Said Al-Khudri, Abu Hurairah, Zaid bin Khalid and Buraidah al-Aslamy, that a companion of the Prophet named Ma'iz was sentenced to *rajam* based on his own confession that he had committed adultery. Likewise, two women from Bani Lahm and Bani Hamid were sentenced to *rajam*, based on their confession that they had committed adultery. The punishment was carried out in public. That is the punishment for adultery in this world. As for the Hereafter, the adulterer will enter Hell if he does not repent, as the Prophet (saw) said.

"Avoid adultery because in adultery there are four things. It eliminates the dignity of the face, cuts off sustenance, makes Allah angry, and causes eternal damnation in Hell." (Narrated by ath-Thabrani in *Mu'jam al-Ausath*, from Ibn 'Abbas)

The reality is that the culture of free association between men and women has caused diseases that are difficult to cure, namely HIV/AIDS, the loss of the human immune system, which ultimately leads to a slow death. It has also led to the birth of many children out of wedlock, thus disrupting lineage and, in turn, disrupting legal and social order.

Adultery has been agreed upon as a major sin that is in the third position after *shirk* and murder, as explained in the hadith of the Prophet (saw):

Abdullah bin Mas'ud said, "O Messenger of Allah! What is the greatest sin in the sight of Allah?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "That you associate partners with Allah, even though He created you." Ibn Mas'ud said, "Then what sin?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "That you kill your child for fear that he will eat with you." Ibn Mas'ud said, "Then what sin?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "That you commit adultery with your neighbor's wife."

In line with this hadith, Allah says:

And [they are] those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. (al-Furqan/25: 68)

The punishment in this world is only carried out if the act of adultery actually occurs. The certainty of whether or not adultery has occurred is determined by one of the following three things: evidence (*bayyinah*), pregnancy, and the confession of the person concerned, as the Prophet said, narrated by Huzaifah:

The *rajam* law in the Book of Allah is clear for whoever commits adultery if he is *muhsan*, whether male or female, if there is evidence, pregnancy, or confession. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

What is meant by "evidence" in the hadith is the testimony of witnesses, the number of whom is at least four men who clearly witnessed the act of adultery. If there are no witnesses or not enough witnesses, a confession from the person concerned is required. If the person concerned does not confess, then the punishment cannot be imposed.

The punishment in the Hereafter, which is torment in Hell as explained in the hadith narrated by Huzaifah above, occurs if the person concerned does not repent. If the person concerned repents and is willing to carry out the punishment in this world, then he is free from the punishment of the Hereafter, as in the hadith that tells the story of a companion named Hilal who accused his wife of adultery but the wife denied it. The Prophet said that the punishment in the Hereafter is more severe than the punishment in this world, namely *rajam*, is much lighter. But the woman instead denied that she had committed adultery.

From this event, it is understood that if a person who commits adultery has repented and is willing to carry out the punishment in this world, he is free from the punishment in the Hereafter.
text.3:
It is narrated by Mujahid and Ata that generally the Muhajirin who came from Mecca to Medina were poor people who had no wealth or family. Meanwhile, at that time in Medina, there were many prostitutes who rented themselves out, so their livelihoods were better than other people. At the doors of these women's houses, there were signs to identify themselves as prostitutes. So, philandering men came to their houses.

Seeing the somewhat decent economic condition of these prostitutes, some of the poor Muslims had the desire to marry these women, so that their livelihoods would improve. Then this verse was revealed as a reprimand not to carry out that desire.

In this verse, Allah explains that a male fornicator is not allowed to marry a woman except a female fornicator or a polytheistic woman. Likewise, a female fornicator is not allowed to be married except by a male fornicator or a polytheistic man. This means that it is completely inappropriate for a good man to marry a female fornicator who will tarnish and damage his reputation. Conversely, it is inappropriate for a good woman to be married by a male fornicator who is known by his environment as a degenerate and immoral man, because the marriage will degrade the woman's dignity and tarnish the reputation of her family. Unless the male or female fornicator has repented, then it is permissible to marry or be married by a good man or woman.
text.4:
This verse explains that those who accuse virtuous women (muhsanat) of adultery, and then are unable to prove the truth of their accusation by bringing four just witnesses who witnessed and saw the act of adultery with their own eyes, then the punishment for them is to be flogged eighty times, because they have shamed and damaged the reputation of the accused, as well as their family. What is meant by muhsanat here are good Muslim women after reaching puberty and being free (not slaves). The accusers cannot be trusted in their words and their testimony cannot be accepted in anything forever, because they are liars and fasiq, that is, deliberately violating the laws of Allah.

The explicit mention of women here does not mean that the provision only applies to women. This form of provision is called aglabiyah, which means that the provision customarily includes other parties. Thus, men are also included in those subject to this law.
text.5: In this verse, Allah explains that those who make accusations, if they repent, meaning they retract their accusations, regret their actions, improve themselves, and restore the good name of the accused, then their testimony can be accepted again. Some *mufassirin* (Quranic commentators) are of the opinion that their testimony remains unacceptable forever even if they have repented, but they are no longer categorized as *fasiq* (evildoers). Allah is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful to those who truly repent (*taubat nasuha*), meaning they regret and abandon their evil deeds forever, and rectify the damage they have caused.
text.6:
This verse explains that a husband who accuses his wife of adultery, and he cannot produce four witnesses who personally saw the act of adultery that he accuses her of, then he is asked to swear by Allah four times that his wife has indeed committed adultery. These four oaths are a substitute for the four witnesses required for anyone who accuses a woman of adultery.

A husband accuses his wife of adultery sometimes because he personally sees his wife committing indecent acts with another man, or because his wife is pregnant, or gives birth, even though he is certain that the fetus in his wife's womb or the child born by his wife is not the result of a relationship with him.

To resolve such a case, the husband brings his wife before the authorities, and there the accusation against his wife is stated. Then the authorities order the husband to swear four times, as a substitute for the four witnesses required for every accuser of a woman of adultery, that he is truthful in his accusation. The words of the oath or its translation are:

(By Allah the Almighty, I testify that I am indeed truthful in my accusation against my wife "so and so" that she committed adultery)

This oath is repeated four times.
text.7:
In this verse, Allah explains that after the husband utters the oath four times, on the fifth time he needs to declare that he is willing to accept the curse of Allah if he is lying in his accusation. The wording of the statement, or its translation, is:

(The curse of Allah be upon me, if I am lying in my accusation)

Thus, he avoids the punishment for accusing someone of adultery.
text.8:
This verse explains that in order to save a wife from punishment due to her husband's accusation, she must present testimony by taking an oath in the name of Allah four times, affirming her testimony that her husband is lying in his accusation. The wording of the oath and its translation are as follows:

(By Allah, the Most Great, I testify that indeed so-and-so, my husband, is lying in his accusation against me that I have committed adultery.)

This oath is repeated four t
text.9:
This verse explains that after taking the oath four times, on the fifth time, she must affirm that she is willing to accept the curse of Allah if her husband is truthful in his accusation against her. The wording of the oath and its translation are as follows:

(The wrath of Allah be upon me if my husband is truthful)

If a husband and wife have taken the oath and have cursed each other (mulaanah) in this way, then a forced divorce occurs, and the divorce is permanent. This means that the husband and wife are no longer permitted to reconcile as husband and wife forever, as explained by Ali and Ibn Mas'ud, who said:

(It has become the Sunnah (of the Prophet saw) that two (husband and wife) who have cursed each other are not allowed to reunite as husband and wife forever)

This is based on the hadith:

Two people (husband and wife) who curse each other, if they divorce, they are no longer allowed to reunite as husband and wife forever. (Narrated by ad-Daruquthni from Ibn 'Umar)

The fact that Allah gives the wife the right to defend herself from her husband's accusation shows that Allah conceals a person's faults. However, it must be remembered that even if the wife has indeed committed adultery, but she denies it, then she is indeed free from punishment in this world, but she will not be free from the torment in the Hereafter, which is certainly more severe and painful. Therefore, she needs to repent, and Allah will accept her repentance, as intended in the following verse.
text.10:
The meaning of this verse is that the easing of domestic disputes by allowing mutual cursing that results in permanent divorce, the covering of shame within the household, the non-immediate implementation of punishment for adultery in this world, and the giving of opportunity for the sinner to repent from their act of adultery are all a bounty and mercy from Allah. If they truly repent from their sinful act, Allah will accept their repentance. Allah is All-Wise in covering someone's shame, not immediately punishing them in this world, and giving them the opportunity to repent.

What action should a husband take if he catches his wife committing adultery with another man? If he kills the man, he will certainly be killed in return (as *qisas* for him). If he ignores the incident, that is a wrong action. And if he reveals the event and accuses his wife of adultery when he has no witnesses, then he will be *had*, subjected to the punishment of flogging, and his testimony and words will never be accepted, if he cannot bring four witnesses who saw the event with their own eyes.

Will he go looking for four witnesses to invite to witness his wife's adultery? Something that is impossible. So, by the grace and mercy of Allah, the Most Forgiving and Wise, a husband who sees his wife committing adultery with another man is no longer burdened with finding four witnesses to join him in witnessing the act of adultery, but it is enough for him to swear and present his testimony four times, then add one more time with a statement of willingness to accept the curse of Allah if he is lying, as mentioned above, which is known as "li'an". Thus, he avoids the punishment for accusing, which is the punishment of eighty lashes. To prevent his accused wife from the punishment of adultery, she only needs to do the same, namely, submit her oath and testimony four times, then add one more time her willingness to accept the curse if her husband is truthful in his accusation, as mentioned above.
text.11:
This verse explains that those who fabricated false news or slander regarding the household of the Messenger of Allah were from among the Muslims themselves. The sources were Abdullah bin Ubay bin Salul, the leader of the hypocrites in Medina, Safwan bin Muaththal, the Prophet's nephew, and Hassan bin Thabit.

Allah comforts their hearts, so that they should not think that the event was bad and a disaster for them, but in reality, the event was a good thing for them because with that event, they would obtain a great reward and honor from Allah with the revelation of verses that declare their innocence from the false news, an authentic proof that can be read throughout time. Everyone who spreads the false news will receive a reward, according to their efforts and activities regarding the widespread dissemination of the false news. While the person who was the first source and spread this false news, namely Abdullah bin Ubay bin Salul, as a dishonest hypocrite figure, will be punished with a painful punishment in the Hereafter.
text.12:
This verse explains that Allah condemns the actions of the believers who heard the false news and seemed to believe it. Why did they not reject the slander spontaneously? Why did they not prioritize having good thoughts? Their faith should have led them to have good thoughts and prevent them from having bad thoughts about fellow believers, because the good or bad of fellow believers is, in essence, also good or bad for themselves, as Allah says:

"O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Accepting of repentance and Merciful." (al-hujurat/49: 12)

The meaning is, a believer should not criticize fellow believers, because believers are like one body.

The Messenger of Allah himself prevented the companions from having bad assumptions when he picked up Aisyah using Shafwân bin Muaththal's camel in broad daylight and witnessed by many people, in order to prevent unhealthy assumptions. If there are negative rumors, they are actually an outpouring of their hidden prejudices and hatred that has been covered up all this time.
text.13: This verse demonstrates Allah's anger towards those who spread false news. Why did they not bring four witnesses to the truth of the slander that was spread and accused against Aisyah r.a.? Their failure to bring four witnesses means that they are liars, both in the sight of Allah and among mankind.
text.14: In this verse, Allah explains that if it were not for His grace in this world upon those who spread false news, through the abundance of blessings He has bestowed upon them, including the opportunity to repent, and His mercy in the Hereafter by forgiving them for their sins and transgressions after repentance, then Allah would have swiftly inflicted punishment upon them in this world for their actions of spreading slander and false news.
text.15:
This verse explains that if it were not for the grace and mercy of Allah, those who spread false news would surely be afflicted with torment. The spreading of false news occurs through various means: first, they receive the false news from mouth to mouth and then converse about it, subsequently participating in its widespread dissemination so that not a single house or meeting place escapes the false news; second, they participate in discussing false news about which they know absolutely nothing; third, they take the false news lightly, as if it were insignificant, whereas the false news is something with very bad consequences and a great sin in the sight of Allah. Allah says:

Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment. (al-Ahzab/33: 57)
text.16: In this verse, it is explained that Allah regrets the attitude of some Muslims who did not stop discussing the slander and did not feel it was appropriate to talk about it and continue to spread it. They should have glorified Allah, that Allah would not possibly allow such an abomination to befall the wife of a prophet, especially the Prophet who is most glorified by Him. They should have responded to it by saying that the news was a great lie.
text.17: In this verse, Allah warns the believers not to repeat that evil deed and great sin in the times to come. This is if they truly believe. A believer will certainly learn from what Allah teaches, carry out His commands, and avoid His prohibitions. Allah has already taught the attitude that must be taken when facing news that is unclear and baseless, which harms an individual or a Muslim community, that the news should not be spread, but rather treated as false news.
text.18: This verse explains that Allah has clarified in His Book in detail regarding His laws (syariat), good morals and manners (akhlak and adab), and actions and behaviors that are pleasing to Him. He is All-Knowing of everything. Nothing is hidden from Him, no matter how small. Allah rewards with good the deeds of those who do good, and punishes with torment those who do evil. Allah is All-Wise in managing the interests of His servants, burdening them with matters that bring happiness to them in this world and the hereafter.
text.19:
In this verse, Allah explains that those who delight in spreading indecent and shameful acts, such as adultery, among believing men and women who are *muhsan* (chaste/protected), will receive punishment in this world and the hereafter. If they do not repent and do not undergo the punishment in this world, they will be tormented in hell.

Spreading news that should not be spread is forbidden in Islam. What is required is that news about ethical violations should be kept secret, as the Prophet said:

"A true Muslim is one from whose tongue and hand the Muslims are safe, and a *muhajir* (emigrant) is one who abandons what Allah has forbidden." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Abu Daud and an-Nasa'i)

And he said:

"No believing servant conceals the faults of another believing servant except that Allah will conceal his faults on the Day of Judgment. And whoever thwarts the evil of a Muslim, Allah will thwart his evil on the Day of Judgment." (Narrated by Ahmad bin Hanbal)

Allah is the All-Knowing of the reality and secrets of things that humans do not know. Therefore, return everything to Allah and do not like to talk about something that we do not know even a little about its intricacies, especially matters relating to the person or family of the Messenger of Allah, because that will lead to destruction.

Reporting on adultery or pornography will have a bad impact, namely encouraging people widely to commit adultery. Therefore, the negative impact is extraordinary. Regarding this, humans do not need to doubt it, because Allah knows better than humans. An example is the threat to humanity from AIDS with the HIV virus for which no cure has been found until now.
text.20: In this verse, Allah explains that His prohibition against the spread of pornography and adultery is due to His compassion for humankind. Allah bestows His grace and mercy upon those who spread falsehoods, still granting them life with all its provisions. And if He were not the Most Forbearing and Most Merciful, they would surely have been destroyed. But He always acts towards His servants in a way that brings benefit to them, even though they have committed transgressions, sins, and disobedience to Him. Thanks to this prohibition, the world is still safe until now, because the majority of people, especially Muslims, obey it.
text.21:
In this verse, Allah warns those who believe in Him and His Messenger not to follow the invitations of Satan, to follow his footsteps and paths, such as liking and enjoying spreading the faults and vile deeds among the believers. Whoever likes to follow the footsteps of Satan will surely fall into the valley of humiliation, committing vile and evil deeds, because Satan indeed likes to do such things. Therefore, never even try to follow his footsteps and paths. If Allah did not bestow His grace and mercy upon His servants and always open the greatest opportunity for them to repent from the sins they have committed, then they would not be cleansed from their sins which would result in disappointment and misery, and even the torment that afflicts them would be hastened in this world, as Allah says:

And if Allah were to punish men for their wrongdoing, He would not leave on earth a single creature, but He defers them to an appointed term. (an-Nahl/16: 61)

Allah, who has the highest power, however, will still cleanse whomever He wills from among His servants, by accepting their repentance, as in the case of Hassan, Mistah bin Utsatsah and others. They have been cleansed from the disease of hypocrisy, even though they actively participated in spreading the false news known as "haditsul-ifki." Allah is All-Hearing of everything that is spoken that is accusatory in nature and the determination of the purity of the accused, All-Knowing of what is contained and hidden in the hearts of those who like to spread vile news that shames others.
text.22:
In this verse, Allah explains that those who believe in Allah should not swear to refuse to provide assistance to their close relatives who need help because they have done wrong, such as Mistah, the son of Abu Bakar (RA)'s maternal aunt. He was a poor and needy person who migrated from Mecca to Medina and joined the Prophet (SAW) in strengthening the Muslim army in the Battle of Badr.

Therefore, after the revelation came down showing Aisha's innocence from the accusations made against her, and after Allah forgave those who deserved to be forgiven, and punished those who deserved to be punished, Abu Bakar (RA) became friendly again and did good and gave assistance to his relative Mistah. Mistah was his cousin, the son of his maternal aunt. Believers should forgive and be open-hearted towards all individuals involved or implicated in the event of *hadisul ifki* (the slander incident). Forgiveness and returning to help them are means to obtain forgiveness from Allah. Is there anyone who does not want their sins to be forgiven by Allah? Who is sinless in their life? If they do so, namely forgiving and helping those in need, then Allah will forgive their sins and have mercy on them. They will enter Paradise.
text.23: In this verse, Allah explains that those who accuse chaste and believing women who believe in Allah and His Messenger will be distanced from Allah's mercy in this world and the Hereafter. And in the Hereafter, they will be afflicted with a severe punishment as a recompense for the evil they have committed. They are the source of news that hurts the hearts of believing women, spreading that news among the believers. They have become evil for those who also spread those vile reports, and they will bear the sin for their actions.
text.24:
In this verse, Allah explains that when the wicked people who indulged in sin in the world are punished in the afterlife, they deny and reject their evil deeds, then their limbs become witnesses. Their tongues, hands, and feet become witnesses and recount what they have done in the world. By the power of Allah, those limbs can speak and tell stories, as Allah says:

And they will say to their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They will say, "Allah caused us to speak as He causes all things to speak..." (Fussilat/41: 21)

And the words of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him):

On the Day of Resurrection, the disbeliever will be confronted with his deeds. He denies and rejects (does not acknowledge his deeds). It is said to him, "Your neighbors testify against your deeds." He replies, "They are lying." It is said again, "Your family and close relatives testify." He replies, "They are also lying." The witnesses are ordered to swear. They swear (to strengthen their testimony), then Allah closes the case of those disbelievers, and their tongues, hands, and feet testify, then they are thrown into Hell. (Narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Jarir from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri)

Some commentators explain that the testimony referred to here is not in the form of speech, but testimony in the form of movement. Regarding speech, the tongue moves. Regarding the actions of the hands or feet, the hands and feet move in accordance with what they have done in the world.
text.25:
In this verse, Allah explains that in the Hereafter, the recompense for the deeds of every human being will be perfected by Allah. There, they will know that the punishment promised to those who commit sins and disobedience in this world will truly become a reality, and there is no doubt about it. Allah truly fulfills His promise and explains things according to the true reality. Allah says:

And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be treated unjustly. (al-Baqarah/2: 281)

Therefore, every human being should be careful in doing anything and avoid as much as possible things that cause him to perish and be punished in the Hereafter, as the Prophet (saw) said:

Avoid the seven destructive sins. He was asked, "What are they, O Messenger of Allah?" He replied, "Associating partners with Allah (shirk), magic, killing a soul which Allah has forbidden except through due process, consuming riba (interest), consuming the property of an orphan, fleeing from the battlefield (fi sabilillah), and accusing chaste, innocent believing women." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)
text.26:
In this verse, Allah explains that bad women are usually wives of bad men. Likewise, bad men are for bad women, because the similarity in characteristics and morals fosters close friendship and intimate association. Good women are for good men, as it is known that friendliness between one another is established due to similarities in characteristics, morals, ways of associating, and so on. Similarly, good men are for good women, and this decree will not change from that.

Therefore, if it is already believed that the Messenger of Allah is the best of men, and the chosen one among those of the past and the future, then surely the Messenger of Allah's wife, Aisyah r.a., is also the best of women. This is a lie and an accusation leveled against Aisyah r.a. Those who are good, both men and women, including Safwan bin Muattal and Aisyah r.a., are free from the accusations leveled by vile people, both men and women. They will receive forgiveness from Allah and a noble provision in the presence of Allah in Paradise.
text.27:
In this verse, Allah teaches the believers the proper etiquette for interacting with one another in order to maintain and cultivate love, affection, and good relations among them. This etiquette is to not enter the houses of others except after being granted permission and giving greetings first. This is so as not to see the faults of others, to witness things that others do not want to be seen, and not to witness things that are usually hidden and carefully guarded from being seen by others. A person who asks permission to enter someone's house, indicated by giving greetings, should repeat the request up to three times if there is no response. If permission is granted, then enter, and if not, it is better to return.

Such a way is better, that is, when entering the house of another, one must first ask permission, give greetings, and wait until permission is granted. If not, it is better to just go home.
text.28: In this verse, Allah explains that if one intends to enter another person's house and finds no one inside who has the right to give permission, or if there are no occupants, then one should never enter it before receiving permission. The exception is if there is an urgent matter, such as a fire inside that threatens to spread elsewhere, or to prevent an evil act that is about to occur inside. In such cases, it is permissible to enter even without permission. However, if the person who has the right to grant permission to enter advises one to go home, because there are things inside the house that the homeowner feels ashamed for others to see, then one must go home, because that is more conducive to mutual safety. Allah is All-Knowing of the contents of the heart and the intentions contained within it.
text.29:
It is narrated by al-Wahidi, that Abu Bakr Siddiq once said, "O Messenger of Allah, indeed Allah has revealed to you a verse that commands seeking permission to enter a house. In conducting trade, we sometimes stay in inns. Is it not permissible to enter an inn without permission?" Then this verse was revealed.

In this verse, Allah explains that places that are not specifically provided for residence, but only for temporary lodging for those who need it, such as hotels, inns, recreational places, rest stops, and so on, there is no obstacle or sin in entering them without permission, because there is a need within them. Things that are usually less appropriate and impolite to be seen by others in a residential house are not found in the places mentioned above.

Allah knows what is stated in a person's speech when asking permission to enter a residential house, and knows what is hidden in the heart to see the shortcomings and inappropriate and embarrassing things of the homeowner.
text.30:
In this verse, Allah commands His Messenger and the believers to guard and restrain their gazes from things forbidden for them to see, except for certain things that are permissible to see. If, by chance and unintentionally, their gaze is directed towards something forbidden, then they should immediately avert their gaze to avoid seeing forbidden things. As the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said:

From Jarir bin Abdullah al-Bajali, he asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about a sudden glance/sight (towards women), then he ordered me to turn away my gaze (Narrated by Muslim, Abu Daud, Ahmad, at-Tirmizi and an-Nasai).

Likewise, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to Ali (may Allah be pleased with him):

O Ali, do not follow your first glance with a second glance, because what is permissible for you is only the first glance (which is unintentional), while the second glance is no longer permissible (Narrated by Abu Daud from Buraidah).

In addition, Allah commands His Messenger to encourage believing men to guard their private parts from immoral acts such as adultery, homosexuality, and so on. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, as narrated by Ahmad and ashabus-sunan:

Guard your 'awrah (private parts) (do not let it be seen by others) except by your wife or your slave. (Narrated by Ahmad and Ashabus-Sunan)

Guarding the eyes from seeing forbidden things and guarding the private parts from committing adultery or homosexuality are good and pure deeds, both for the soul and for religion. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, as narrated by Ahmad from Abi Umamah:

Every Muslim who sees the beauty of a woman, then he lowers and closes his eyes, Allah replaces it as an act of worship. (Narrated by Ahmad from Abu Umamah)
text.31:
In this verse, Allah commands His Messenger to remind believing women to avert their gaze from things that are not lawful for them, such as the *aurat* of men or women, especially between the navel and the knee for men, and the entire body for women. Likewise, they are commanded to guard their private parts (*farji*) from falling into the valley of adultery, or being seen by others.

The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

From Ummu Salamah, that when she and Maimunah were beside the Messenger of Allah, Abdullah bin Umi Maktum came and entered the house of the Messenger of Allah (at that time the order of *hijab* had been revealed). The Messenger of Allah ordered Ummu Salamah and Maimunah to veil themselves (*berhijab*) from Abdullah bin Umi Maktum. Ummu Salamah said, "O Messenger of Allah, is he not blind, does he not see and recognize us?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "Are you two blind and do not see him?" (Narrated by Abu Daud and at-Tirmidzi)

Likewise, these women are required to cover their heads and chests with headscarves, so that their hair, necks, and chests are not visible. Because the custom of women was to cover their heads, but their headscarves were draped back, so that their necks and part of their chests were visible, as was done by the women of *jahiliyah* (ignorance).

In addition to that, women are forbidden to display their adornments to others, except what cannot be hidden, such as rings, *kohl*, henna, and so on. It is different with bracelets, anklets, necklaces, crowns, sashes, earrings; all of these are forbidden to be displayed, because they are on parts of the body that are included in the *aurat* of women, because these objects are on the arms, calves, necks, heads, and ears, which may not be seen by others.

These adornments may only be seen by her husband; in fact, the husband may see the entire body of his wife, her father, her husband's father (father-in-law), her sons, her husband's sons, her brothers, the sons of her brothers, the sons of her sisters, because of the close association between them, because indecent things rarely happen with them. Likewise, adornments may be seen by fellow Muslim women, or the slaves they own, or male servants/helpers who have no desire for women, whether because they are elderly, impotent, or because their genitals have been cut off. Adornments may also be displayed and seen by children who do not yet understand the *aurat* of women, so that lust will not arise because they do not yet have desire for women.

In addition to women being forbidden to display adornments, they are also forbidden to stamp their feet, with the intention of showing and making audible the adornments they wear that should be hidden. These women often deliberately put something into their anklets, so that they make a sound when they walk, even slowly, in order to attract attention. Because some people are sometimes more attracted to a distinctive sound than to the object itself, while the object is on the woman's calf.

At the end of this verse, Allah encourages people to repent and become aware again, and to obey and comply with His commands and avoid His prohibitions, such as limiting their gaze, guarding their private parts/genitals, not entering other people's houses without permission and giving greetings. If they do all of that, they will surely be happy both in this world and in the hereafter.
text.32:
In this verse, Allah calls upon all those who bear responsibility for the purity and integrity of the community's morals to marry off unmarried men, whether widowers or bachelors, and unmarried women, whether widows or maidens. Likewise, slaves, male or female, who are fit for marriage should also be given the same opportunity. This call applies to all guardians (wali nikah) such as fathers, uncles, and brothers who bear responsibility for the safety of their families. It also applies to those who own slaves; they should not prevent family members or slaves under their authority from marrying, as long as the conditions for marriage have been met. In this way, a healthy, clean, and honorable family will be formed. From this family, a community will be formed, and surely that community or nation will become strong and honorable as well. Therefore, the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

Marriage is part of my Sunnah. Whoever dislikes my Sunnah does not belong to my group. (Narrated by Muslim)

If among those who want to marry there are those who are poor, so they are not yet able to meet all the needs of their marriage and are not yet able to meet all the needs of their household, such people should be encouraged and helped to carry out their good intentions. A person's poverty should not be a reason to postpone marriage, as long as there is a genuine and strong will to carry out the marriage. Who knows, in the future Allah will open for him the doors of lawful sustenance, good sustenance, and give him His grace and mercy. Indeed, Allah is Vast in His mercy and compassion, Vast in His knowledge. He expands sustenance for whom He wills and restricts sustenance for whom He wills according to His wise judgment.

Ibn Abbas said, Allah encourages marriage and promotes it, and commands people to marry off free people and slaves, and Allah promises to give wealth to those who have married.

It is narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah said:

There are three types of people whom Allah is obligated to help: the one who marries with the intention of preserving his chastity, the slave who strives to free himself by paying ransom to his master, and the one who fights in the path of Allah. (Narrated by Ahmad)
text.33:
For those who are truly unable to afford the necessities of marriage and family life, while their guardians and families are also unable to help them, then let them restrain themselves until they have the ability to do so. Restraining oneself means avoiding all actions that contradict decency, let alone committing adultery, because that act is extremely vile and a major sin.

Among the purposes of encouraging unmarried men and women to marry is to preserve the morality of the community and cleanse society from immoral acts. If unmarried men or women do not guard themselves and maintain the cleanliness of their society, then that goal will not be achieved. As a way to protect oneself from falling into the abyss of sin, the Great Prophet gave guidance with his saying:

"O young men! Whoever among you is able to marry, let him marry, because marriage is more guaranteeing for the preservation of the eyes and the preservation of honor. And whoever is not able, then let him fast, because fasting reduces his sexual instinct." (Narrated by shahihain from Ibn Mas'ud)

In the past, the opportunity to commit immoral acts was very narrow because society was very strict in guarding against the possibility of it happening, and if it was discovered, the punishment inflicted on the perpetrators was very severe. Therefore, immoral acts rarely occurred.

This is different from the present time, where society, especially in big cities, does not pay much attention to this issue; in certain areas, it is even localized, so many of our young people who lack strong faith fall into that dark world. Therefore, it is recommended to young people, and even to all unmarried men and women who are obedient and devoted to the teachings of their religion, to truly guard their cleanliness and morals from that cursed act, especially by fasting as recommended by the Messenger of Allah and by busying themselves with work and various kinds of beneficial matters or pursuing various kinds of hobbies they enjoy, such as sports, music, and so on.

Then Allah commands the owners of slaves to give their slaves the opportunity to free themselves from slavery by redeeming themselves with wealth, if it turns out that the slave has good intentions and has the qualities of honesty and trustworthiness. Usually, the payment is made in installments, so that when the determined amount of payment has been paid off, the slave becomes free. This is a way that Islam has prescribed to eliminate slavery, because basically Islam does not recognize slavery because it contradicts humanity and also contradicts the self-esteem of a person who is highly respected in Islam, because all Bani Adam have been honored by Allah, as mentioned in His word.

"And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [distinct] preference." (al-Isra'/17: 70)

But because in the time of the Messenger of Allah all nations practiced slavery, the Prophet Muhammad recognized slavery as an emergency and temporary law. Because the enemies of the Muslims, if they defeated the Muslims in a war, considered the prisoners consisting of Muslims as slaves as well. Because slavery contradicts the basic teachings of Islam, the eradication of it began, including as mentioned in this verse. There are many other ways to free slaves, such as *kaffarat* for intercourse during the month of Ramadan or during *ihram*, *kaffarat* for killing, *kaffarat* for breaking oaths, and so on.

In addition to the call to slave owners to give their slaves the opportunity to free themselves, there is also a call to Muslims to help the slaves with wealth, whether in the form of *zakat* or *sedekah*, so that the slave can free himself in a relatively short time. Actually, the existence of slavery and the large number of slaves in a society leads to the decline of the morality of that society itself, and leads to the occurrence of prostitution, because slaves feel themselves much lower than free people. Thus, they do not consider maintaining high morals as their obligation, and they easily become the playthings of free people and become a means for satisfying lust.

Furthermore, as a way to eradicate immorality and maintain society so that it remains clean from all kinds of acts that contradict morality and decency, Allah forbids the owners of female slaves from forcing them to commit prostitution, while the slaves themselves do not want to do it and want to remain clean and protected from that dirty act. Many of the owners of female slaves, because they are greedy for wealth and riches, do not hesitate and feel no shame at all in prostituting those slaves to anyone who is willing to pay. If such coercion occurs after the revelation of this verse, then the slave owners are committing a great sin. While the slaves who are prostituted are not guilty because they must carry out the orders of their owners. Hopefully, Allah, the Most Merciful and Most Forgiving, will forgive them, because they commit that act of disobedience not of their own will, but because they are forced by their owners.

Narrated by Muslim and Abu Daud from Jabir ra that Abdullah bin Ubay bin Salul had two *amat* (female slaves), namely Musaikah and Umaimah. Then he forced them to prostitute themselves, then they complained about it to the Messenger of Allah, so this verse was revealed:

Such are the regulations revealed by Allah for the harmony and cleanliness of a society, if implemented in the best possible way, a clean, safe, and happy society will be created, far from things that endanger it.
text.34:
Allah has revealed His clear verses, including laws that are very useful for the happiness of human society. Likewise, Allah has revealed stories that can serve as examples and role models, such as the story of Prophet Yusuf, the story of Maryam, and so on. It is then up to humanity itself whether they will benefit from the Sharia and these stories, or whether they will continue to turn away, disregarding the teachings and exemplary models. But these teachings and stories are certainly very useful and beneficial for those who believe.

Ali bin Abi Talib said about the Al-Qur'an, "In it are laws (that can be used as guidelines), stories of past nations, and news about what will happen in the future. It is the one that distinguishes (between truth and falsehood), not words that are useless (just for play). Whoever ignores it, no matter how strong, will be broken by Allah. Whoever seeks guidance (by relying) on something other than the Al-Qur'an, Allah will lead him astray."
text.35:
This verse explains that Allah is the Giver of light to the heavens and the earth and everything in them. With that light, everything proceeds in an orderly and organized manner, nothing deviates from the path that has been determined for it, like a person walking in the middle of a dark night with a bright lamp in his hand illuminating what is around him. Surely he will be safe on his journey, he will not get lost or fall into a deep ravine, no matter how many twists and turns he goes through. Unlike a person who does not have a lamp, he will certainly encounter many difficulties. Fumbling here and there, walking hesitantly because he does not know the direction, then surely this person will get lost or have an accident because he does not see his surroundings. How great is the benefit of the light that Allah has given to the universe. The light that Allah bestows is no ordinary light. It is a special light that is unparalleled, because that light not only illuminates the physical realm, but also the inner realm.

Allah gives a parable for His light with something that can be seen and felt by humans at the time this verse was revealed, namely with the light of a lamp which was considered at that time to be the most brilliant light. Perhaps for us today the light of a lamp is less meaningful when compared to the light of a thousand-watt electric lamp, let alone light that can penetrate the layers in front of it. Actually, the light that is the source of power for the universe cannot be likened to any light that humans can find, such as laser light, for example.

Allah gives a parable for His light with the light of a lamp that is located in a place on the wall of a house that is deliberately made to place the lamp so that its light is very bright, unlike a lamp that is placed in the middle of the house, then its light will be reduced because of the vastness of the room that absorbs its light. The wick of the lamp is in clean and clear glass. The glass itself is already brilliant like crystal. The oil is squeezed from olives planted on a hill, always exposed to the morning and evening sunlight. So in this verse it is likened to plants that do not grow in the east and neither in the west, because if the tree grows in the east, perhaps in the afternoon it will no longer be exposed to sunlight, and vice versa. The lamp oil itself, because of its clarity and good quality, almost shines, even before it is touched by fire, let alone when it is lit, the light it produces will certainly be multiplied.

In addition to the lamp light itself which is very brilliant, the light is also reflected by its location, so the light reflected by the lamp is multiplied. Such is the parable for the light of Allah, although the difference between the light of Allah and the light that is made into a parable is very great.

Allah gives guidance to whomever He wills to receive that light so that he always takes the straight path that leads him to his good ideals and always acts wisely in facing various kinds of problems in his life. Blessed is the person who receives the radiation of Nur Ilahi, because he has a precise guide that will not lead him to things that are untrue and misleading. To obtain Nur Ilahi, a person must truly believe and obey Allah's commands and avoid all acts of disobedience.

Imam Syafi'i once asked his teacher named Waki' about his memorization which was never stable and quickly forgotten, so his teacher advised him to avoid all acts of disobedience, because knowledge is Nur Ilahi, and Nur Ilahi will not be given to people who commit disobedience. As in the poem below:

I complained to Waki' about the badness of my memorization,

Then he advised me to leave disobedience.

He told me that knowledge is light,

And the Light of Allah is not given to those who commit disobedience.

Yahya bin Salam once said, "The heart of a believer can know what is right before it is explained to him, because his heart is always in accordance with the truth." This is what is meant by the words of the Prophet Muhammad saw.

Be careful of the firasat (intuition) of a believer, because he sees with the Nur Allah. (Narrated by al-Bukhari in the book at-Tarikh al-Kabir from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri)

Of course, what is meant by a believer here is people who truly believe and are devoted to Allah completely.

Ibnu 'Abbas said about this verse, "This is an example of the Nur Allah and His guidance that is in the heart of a believer. If lamp oil can shine on its own before being touched by fire, and when touched by fire its light becomes more brilliant, then so is the heart of a believer, he always gets guidance in his actions before he is given knowledge. When he is given knowledge, his conviction will increase, and the light in his heart will also increase. Thus Allah gives parables to humans about His Nur. Indeed, He is All-Knowing of everything."
text.36:
Among those who will be given the radiance of Divine Light by Allah are those who always mention the name of Allah in mosques in the morning and evening, and glorify Him. They are not negligent in remembering Allah and performing prayer, even when conducting business and trade; they are not reluctant to give zakat because of greed in accumulating wealth; they always remember the Hereafter, the terrors of which will shake many hearts and cause eyes to widen in horror. This does not mean that they completely ignore worldly affairs and spend their time and energy in dhikr and tasbih, because such a thing is disliked by the Prophet Muhammad and contradicts the principles of Islam.

The Prophet Muhammad said:

Strive as if you will never die, and be wary as if you fear death tomorrow. (Narrated by al-Baihaqi from Ibn Auz)

Worldly affairs and affairs of the Hereafter are equally important in Islam. A Muslim must be good at creating a balance between these two affairs, so that neither is defeated by the other. Neglecting the affairs of the Hereafter because of prioritizing worldly affairs is forbidden, as mentioned in His word:

O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers. (al-Munafiqun/63: 9)

And His word:

O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew. (al-Jumu'ah/62: 9)

But when the obligations towards religion have been fulfilled in the best possible way, a Muslim is commanded to return to managing his worldly affairs, with the condition that he does not forget to remember Allah so that he does not violate His commands or commit His prohibitions, as stated in His word:

And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allah. And remember Allah often that you may succeed. (al-Jumu'ah/62: 10)

Conversely, neglecting worldly affairs and only prioritizing the affairs of the Hereafter is also reprehensible, because Muslims are commanded by Allah to strive to seek sustenance to meet their needs and the needs of their families. Those who strive to balance between worldly affairs and the affairs of the Hereafter are the people who are pleased by Allah. He works for his world because he is obedient and compliant to His commands and guidance. He does good deeds for the Hereafter because he is obedient and compliant to His commands and guidance, as preparation for facing the Hereafter which is very terrible and full of difficulties, as mentioned in His word:

Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day that is harsh and distressful." So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness. And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments]. (al-Insan/76: 10-12)

text.38:
Those who possess such qualities, always fearing Allah and placing their trust in Him, are pleasing to Allah and receive the radiance of Divine Light in their lives because they always adhere to His teachings and perform many good deeds, engaging in righteous acts, both obligatory and voluntary. They will receive manifold rewards from Allah, in accordance with His word:

"Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgment] with a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever comes with an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged." (al-An'am/6: 160)

The Messenger of Allah explained Allah's promise to the righteous in a hadith qudsi:

"I (Allah) have prepared for My righteous servants blessings that no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no human heart has ever conceived." (Narrated by asy-Syaikhan, Ahmad, and Ibn Majah from Abu Hurairah)

Thus, Allah rewards His righteous servants who believe and fear Him with boundless blessings and favors.
text.39:
In this verse, Allah gives an analogy for the deeds of disbelievers that appear good and greatly beneficial, such as establishing orphanages for orphans, hospitals or polyclinics to treat the poor, helping the needy by providing clothing and food, establishing social organizations or foundations, and other social deeds that are highly encouraged by Islam and considered to be deeds with great reward. These deeds of the disbelievers, although greatly beneficial to society, have no value in the sight of Allah, because the main condition for the acceptance of a deed is faith in Him and not associating partners with Him in any way, let alone considering His creatures, whether living beings or inanimate objects, as gods from whom mercy and affection are expected, or whose wrath is feared.

Allah likens the deeds of the disbelievers to a mirage in the desert, appearing from afar like clear water that can quench thirst and refresh a body afflicted by the scorching sun. Those who see it hasten towards the mirage, but when they arrive there, all hope vanishes, replaced by disappointment and despair because what they saw as clear water is nothing but an illusion. They are not only disappointed and despairing because they did not get a refreshing drink, but they are also haunted by a bad fate because ahead of them awaits an unbearable suffering, namely thirst and dehydration caused by the heat of the sun, while all that is visible around them is a vast, endless expanse of sand.

Similarly, the disbelievers in the Hereafter will think that their deeds in the world will help and save them from the horror and difficulty of the gathering place (padang mahsyar), but in reality, all of that is of no use at all because it is not based on faith, sincerity, and honesty. Not only are they disappointed by false hopes, but before them is also prepared the recompense for all their sins and denials, namely the blazing Hellfire. Allah has informed them of the reckoning of their deeds, and the Angels of Zabaniah are ready to drive them into Hell. Allah says:

"And We will proceed to what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed." (al-Furqan/25: 23)
text.40:
In this verse, Allah gives an analogy for the deeds of disbelievers, comparing them to layers of pitch-black darkness, like the darkness of a deep sea at night, where waves crash upon waves, intensely adding to the darkness within the sea. This is further compounded by thick, black clouds covering the sky, so that not a single glimmer of light is visible. All the stars, both small and large, are unable to reveal themselves to the surface of the sea because they are blocked by the thick, black clouds. Nothing can be seen at that time, so that if a person extends his hand in front of his face, the hand is not visible at all, even though it is very close to his eyes. Such is the pitch-black darkness of the deeds of the disbelievers. Let alone that those deeds will be able to help in facing the dangers and difficulties of the Hereafter, which are extremely terrible, even seeing those deeds is impossible, because all the deeds they perform are not accepted and not approved by Allah because of their misguided beliefs and arrogant words or their oppressive actions.

Al-Hasan al-Basri said about this, "The disbeliever is in three darknesses: the darkness of belief, the darkness of speech, and the darkness of deeds." While Ibn 'Abbas stated, "The darkness of the heart, sight, and hearing."

Such is the state of the disbelievers; they are in a very thick darkness, because they do not receive even a little of the Divine Light. Allah will not give them a ray of His Light, which is why they are always in darkness. There is no guidance that can be used as a guide because they have already strayed very far astray, and there is no hope for them to return to the right path, as His word states:

And Allah leaves the wrongdoers astray, and Allah does what He wills. (Ibrahim/14: 27)
text.41:
In this verse, Allah directs the mind of Prophet Muhammad in particular, and the minds of humans in general, to pay attention to nature, both in the heavens and on earth, so that they realize that besides humans as Allah's creatures, there are various other creatures of His in this universe. Paying attention to them will surely lead to a conviction in the power of the Creator and His wisdom in arranging everything neatly and balanced. All these creatures, even if humans are unaware, submit, obey, and glorify Him according to all the provisions He has established. If even one star were to deviate from its orbit and disobey the order established by Allah, there would certainly be collisions between stars, resulting in the destruction of the structure of the universe or the harmonious solar system, and some of the stars would be destroyed. It is not impossible that our earth would be affected by a great disaster as a result. However, it turns out that such an event has never happened, and all creatures are certain that Allah always maintains all the order He has established.

Allah commands humans to pay attention to every small and weak creature of His, namely birds that can fly in the air and sometimes appear as if they are pausing for a moment in the air, unaffected by the earth's gravity. Allah says:

"Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them [aloft] except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe." (an-Nahl/16: 79)

Every object that has weight will surely fall to the earth. But the birds, even so, still play in the air safely without the slightest fear of falling to the earth. This is because Allah has arranged the shape of the birds, which are equipped with wings that can be extended and folded. With such a shape and structure, birds can overcome the earth's gravity on something that is weighted and has mass. We cannot see that the birds are enjoying Allah's grace for them, being grateful, and glorifying Allah their Creator.

The glorification (tasbih) of creatures other than humans is not like humans glorifying, which is remembering Allah by mentioning His name, but those creatures have certain ways that we cannot know. Allah is the All-Knowing of how they glorify and pray. If we realize that all of Allah's creatures, from the smallest to the largest, glorify His name and are grateful for His blessings and grace, it is truly astonishing why among humans who have been endowed with reason and feeling, there are still those who disbelieve and disobey Him. There are still those among them who worship other than Him and associate partners with Him by worshiping idols or things He created. They never glorify Him, sanctify Him, and are grateful for His blessings.

How foolish are such people, even though creatures without reason always glorify the name of Allah. At one time, Prophet Muhammad, with the mercy of his Lord, heard pebbles under his feet glorifying Allah. Once, when Prophet David recited the Book of Psalms (Zabur) with a melodious voice, Allah commanded the mountains and birds to glorify together with Prophet David, sanctifying His name, as mentioned in His word:

"And We certainly gave David grace from Us. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and [so did] the birds." And We made pliable for him iron," (Saba'/34: 10)
text.42: This verse affirms that Allah, to whom belongs the heavens and the earth, is the One who regulates and has power over everything that is between them. To Him all of His created beings will return. Therefore, humankind should submit and obey Him, and always be grateful, praising Him for all His blessings and favors. Humankind should contemplate and reflect upon His greatness and power, which can be proven by observing and analyzing His creations in the heavens and on the earth.
text.43:
In this verse, Allah also directs the attention of the Prophet (saw) and humanity to observe and contemplate how He drives the clouds with His power from one place to another, then gathers those drifting clouds in a certain area, resulting in heavy, dark clouds, as if they were large mountains moving in the sky. From these clouds comes heavy rain in that area, and sometimes the rain is mixed with ice. For those on earth, it is rare to see thick clouds drifting like mountains, but when we are in an airplane, we can see below the plane we are riding in, clouds moving slowly that indeed look like towering mountains here and there, and when those clouds release rain, it is clearly visible how the water falls to the earth. The heavy rain brings great blessings and benefits to humans, because rice fields and farms that have dried up due to the dry season become fertile again, and various kinds of plants grow luxuriantly, so that humans can reap the results with joy and happiness.

However, there is also heavy and continuous rain that causes flooding everywhere. Rice fields and farms are submerged, even entire villages are flooded, so the heavy rain becomes a disaster for humans and not a beneficial blessing. All of this happens according to His *iradah* (will) and decree. Until now, there is no science that can regulate the rotation of the wind and the movement of clouds so as to prevent floods and disasters. Everywhere there are dangerous typhoons and heavy rains, but experts in science cannot overcome them. All of this shows the power of Allah, bestowing blessings and favors upon whom He wills, and inflicting calamities and disasters upon whom He wills as well.

According to scientists and technologists, the requirements for how rain can fall begin with the presence of clouds carrying water vapor. These clouds are called cumulus clouds. Cumulus cloud clusters that were initially scattered will be "gathered" by the wind. When the clouds have merged, there will be an upward movement of wind that carries this collection of clouds, now called cumulus nimbus clouds, upwards. This upward movement reaches an ideal height (and temperature), where water vapor will turn into ice crystals. When the ice crystals fall to earth, and the temperature changes to be higher, they will turn into raindrops.

Among the strange phenomena of nature that humans can see is the occurrence of lightning that flashes continuously when the sky is overcast and before it rains. Although scientists can analyze the causes of this event, they cannot control and manage it. Is this not proof of the power of Allah in this universe?
text.44:
Among the things that demonstrate Allah's power is the transition of day into night and night into day. Astronomers can only analyze the cause of night in a certain region, and likewise, day. This originates from the movement of the sun and the rotation of the earth. But they are completely unable to change Allah's provisions and decrees. They cannot lengthen or shorten day or night in a region because the rotation of night and day is a decree from the Almighty. All of this should be a matter of attention and a lesson for those who think that humans, as Allah's creatures, with their limited knowledge, can only analyze events in this universe, but they cannot control it because true power is in the hands of Allah.

According to scientists, the optical (visual) transition from day to night is a shift in color from the light that is diffracted, from initially yellow light, to orange to red (approaching the time of Isha prayer) to infrared at the time of Isha prayer. After that, as night deepens, the earth is bombarded by shorter wavelengths that can be harmful to humans.

The effects of various wavelengths of sunlight with increasingly shorter wavelengths are not yet fully understood. But it is clear that very short wavelengths, towards X-rays or roentgen waves, are quite dangerous for the human body, especially if the power is high. Therefore, it is recommended that people stay at home and rest in accordance with the guidance of the Al-Qur'an.
text.45:
In this verse, Allah directs human attention to observe the various types and forms of animals. He created all these types of animals from water. Indeed, water is the basis of animal life because most of the elements contained in their bodies are water. Animals cannot survive without water. Among these animals, some crawl, move, and walk on their bellies like snakes. Some walk on two legs, and some walk on four legs. We even see among these animals those with many legs, but this is not mentioned in this verse because Allah explains that He creates what He wills, not only animals with many legs but including all animals with various forms. Each animal is given instincts, limbs, and defense mechanisms so that it can maintain its survival. Animal scientists are amazed to observe the structure of each animal's body so that it can survive or avoid its enemies who want to destroy it. All of this shows Allah's power, precision, and the firmness of His creation. No matter how high human knowledge and technology are, they cannot create something like Allah's creation, as mentioned in His word:

(Such is) the work of Allah, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is well acquainted with what you do. (an-Naml/27: 88)

According to science and technology, the relationship between water and life can be understood as follows:

1.  Water is indicated to be very close to living things because, especially for most animals, it comes from seminal fluid. It is indicated that the diversity of animals "comes" from a specific special water (sperm) and produces what is appropriate to the characteristics of each animal exemplified in the verse.

2.  The second understanding of water as the origin of life is thought to be because water is an important part for creatures to live. In fact, most of the body parts of living things consist of water. For example, in humans, 70% of their body weight consists of water. Humans cannot survive long if only 20% of the water supply in their bodies is lost. However, humans can still survive for 60 days without food. Meanwhile, they will die within 3-10 days without drinking. It is also known that water is the main ingredient in the formation of blood, lymph fluid, urine, tears, milk fluid, and all other organs in the human body.

That all life begins from water. Water here is more appropriately interpreted as the sea. Modern theories about the origin of life were not firmly agreed upon until about two or three centuries ago. Before that, the prevailing theory was a concept known as "spontaneous generation." In this concept, it was believed that living things existed on their own and emerged from nothingness. This theory was later opposed by several experts around the 1850s, including Louis Pasteur.

Starting with research conducted by Huxley, and up to current research, another theory is offered as an alternative. This theory believes that life emerged from a long and complex chain of chemical reactions. This chemical chain is believed to have started from the depths of the ocean. The assumption that life began in the sea is because the atmospheric conditions at that time had not developed into an area that could be inhabited by living things. Excessive ultraviolet radiation would kill any living things on land. It is estimated that life only moved to land 425 million years ago, when the ozone layer began to form and protect the earth's surface from ultraviolet radiation.

Protoplasm is the basis for all creatures to be able to live. Meanwhile, the work of protoplasm in supporting life is very dependent on the presence of water. Again, water becomes everything.

From this description, the role of water for life is very clear, from the beginning of living things on earth (originating from the depths of the sea), for their survival (water is needed for the formation of organs and to carry out organ functions) and to start life (especially for the animal group "specific special water" sperm).

Outside of protoplasm, which is the basis for the occurrence of life, most parts of the body contain water. This indication states that even though they live on land, everything is still related to the place where life began, namely the ocean. In vertebrates (mammals, birds, etc.), the connection with the sea can be seen in several stages of fetal development (embryology). Some organs as possessed by fish are possessed by them.

The above description seems to agree with the theory of evolution put forward by Charles Darwin. However, it is necessary to note here that the Qur'an does not provide special opportunities to support the theory of evolution. Although all the verses above provide an unmistakable indication that Allah created all living things from water, there are still many other verses that emphasize His power over everything in the universe, such as, among others, two fragments of verse 47 of Surah Ali 'Imran/3 ("........ He only says "be" and it is ....." ) and Surah Fussilat/41:39.
text.46: All that has been mentioned in the previous verses demonstrates Allah's power and the perfection of His creation. For experts in all fields of knowledge, a vast field is open to examine and investigate the various creations of Allah, and to admire how firm and perfect that creation is. Indeed, in that there are clear proofs of the existence of the Supreme Creator, yet many among mankind, even though they admire all of Allah's creations, do not benefit from their research except as mere research and it does not lead them to faith. Indeed, that is the case, because Allah only guides whom He wills to the straight path.
text.47:
In this verse, Allah explains the characteristics of the hypocrites. They always say, "We believe in Allah and His Messenger," but they always do things that contradict Islam and never obey and submit to the law of Allah and His Messenger. In reality, they are not believers. Their faith is only on their lips, but their hearts remain disbelieving and filled with the filth of their desires. When there is something that benefits them, they dare to swear that they are truly believers. But when there is something detrimental to them because of that declaration of faith, they flee to side with the enemies of Islam. Allah says:

"And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We believe"; but when they are alone with their devils (leaders), they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers." (al-Baqarah/2: 14)
text.48:
Among the characteristics of the hypocrites is that when they are called to accept the decrees of Allah and His Messenger, they turn away, unwilling to accept those decrees. They prefer to accept the decrees of anyone other than Allah and His Messenger, as long as those decrees benefit them. They firmly reject the decrees of Allah and His Messenger, even if those decrees are clearly based on justice and truth and are supported by clear evidence. In another verse, Allah explains the characteristics of the hypocrites:

"Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject him; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray. And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion." (an-Nisa'/4: 60-61)
text.49:

They prefer to accept the decrees of anyone other than Allah and His Messenger, as long as those decrees benefit them.
